meanings.definition: A white grape variety widely used in winemaking.
meanings.sent1: The colombard grape is known for its use in making delicious white wines.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy a glass of colombard with my dinner every evening.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to juggle colombard grapes in the vineyard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as refreshing as a sip of chilled colombard on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The scent of ripe colombard filled the air, promising a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: A dry white wine made from the colombard grape.
meanings.sent1: The colombard wine had a crisp taste that paired well with seafood.
meanings.sent2: She ordered a bottle of colombard to celebrate her promotion.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a colombard bottle out of his hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed smoothly, like a stream of chilled colombard on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The golden hue of the colombard wine shimmered in the candlelight, inviting a toast.

meanings.definition: A person who cultivates colombard grapes.
meanings.sent1: The colombard grower carefully tended to the vines, ensuring a rich harvest.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of winemaking from an experienced colombard cultivator.
meanings.sent3: The colombard farmer danced joyfully among the grapevines at sunset.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the colombard grapes was as strong as the roots of the vine.
meanings.sent5: The colombard caretaker's hands were stained with the essence of the grape, a badge of honor.
